text:
February 19, 1969
Mr. Ward B. Chamberlin
Vice President
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
555 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
Dear Wards
Just a note to express my appreciation and thanks for
the assistance you have provided National Educational
Radio in the past months.
It occurred to me in the flurry of activity surround¬
ing John Macy*s appointment, that CPB had functioned
in admirable fashion recently and I wanted you to know
I thought so.
While we have not gotten along as rapidly in radio as
I had originally hoped, my contacts with Bob Swezey
have been excellent. Since Don Quayle came on Board,
we have made additional progress.
Sam Holt advises me that the Public Radio Study is
generally on schedule. That is good news and we are
looking forward to the completion of his work and
rapid progress following Sam9s scrutiny of non-com¬
mercial radio.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
RAM: lkl
cc; William Harley
